meanings.definition: Believing in the doctrine of the Second Coming of Christ before the millennium.
meanings.sent1: She held strong premillennial beliefs about the return of Christ.
meanings.sent2: The premillennial view suggests Christ will return before the millennium.
meanings.sent3: His premillennial predictions made him the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: The premillennial hope shone brightly in their hearts.
meanings.sent5: The premillennial anticipation filled the air with excitement.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the belief in the Second Coming of Christ before the millennium.
meanings.sent1: The premillennial interpretation of the prophecy fascinated her.
meanings.sent2: Their premillennial perspective shaped their approach to the future.
meanings.sent3: The premillennial decorations at the party were a hit.
meanings.sent4: In the premillennial light, everything seemed more hopeful.
meanings.sent5: The premillennial atmosphere was charged with expectation.
